Experiment_description: Experiments involved creating baseline models using logistic regression in PyTorch for SPR sequences. Each model focused on interpretability and rule extraction, with performance evaluated on validation and test datasets.
Significance: These experiments are important for establishing interpretable baseline models that combine symbolic and neural methods, paving the way for more complex neuro-symbolic models in future research. The findings highlight the potential and limitations of logistic regression for sequence prediction tasks.
Description: The methods involved training logistic regression models on bag-of-characters representations of SPR sequences. Models were evaluated on their ability to generalize, with metrics such as accuracy and rule-based accuracy tracked. Issues like overfitting and class imbalance were observed, providing insights for model improvement.

List_of_included_plots.description: The accuracy plot shows that the training accuracy steadily increases over the epochs, reaching above 90%, while the validation accuracy peaks around 80% and fluctuates slightly afterward.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: This plot highlights potential overfitting, as the training accuracy significantly exceeds validation accuracy, indicating the model performs better on the training data.

List_of_included_plots.description: The validation accuracy shows a steady improvement, eventually surpassing the rule-based accuracy (RBA).
List_of_included_plots.analysis: This plot demonstrates that the neural model outperforms the rule-based system in terms of validation accuracy, indicating better generalization capabilities.

List_of_included_plots.description: The confusion matrix shows that the model performs reasonably well, with higher counts along the diagonal, indicating correct predictions.
List_of_included_plots.analysis: This visualization reveals the model's ability to predict both classes accurately, though some misclassifications suggest areas for improvement in class-specific learning.

Key_numerical_results.analysis: Indicates a strong performance, but with possible overfitting due to the discrepancy between training and validation accuracy.

Key_numerical_results.description: Final test accuracy from node a5e1dab67a1d41689df6778ff140539b.
Key_numerical_results.analysis: Suboptimal performance, likely due to incorrect dataset loading or overly simplistic synthetic data.
Represents the highest performance among the nodes, with better generalization than rule-based accuracy.

Key_numerical_results.description: Final rule-based accuracy from nodes 7f9710a8637448008cf34f1f3c7e7d07, 80a558d3c01a47fa92aae47a5a391454, and 6602bb735cd54b7f9012ff0692a08325.
Key_numerical_results.analysis: Serves as a baseline for model performance, surpassed by neural models in validation accuracy.
